PARTY.Definition: one of the people or groups involved in a transaction

MORTGAGE.Definition: an agreement that allows you to borrow money from a bank

LENDS.Definition: gives something for a period of time, expecting to be given it back

INSTALLMENTS.Definition: one of a series of payments

LEASE.Definition: pay money to use something over a period of time, e.g. a car, house

LOAN.Definition: an amount of money that is borrowed and needs to be paid back

SOVEREIGN.Definition: relating to a king, queen, or government

BORROWING.Definition: using something that belongs to someone with the agreement that you will give it back later

INVESTORS.Definition: people who put money into a project in order to gain money

BONDS.Definition: an official document that promises that a government or company will pay back money in the future

CIRCUMSTANCES.Definition: the conditions that affect a situation

RATIOS.Definition: the relationship between two amounts that shows how large one is compared to the other

RATIO.Definition: the relationship between two amounts that shows how large one is compared to the other

BORROW.Definition: use something that belongs to someone with the agreement that you will give it back later

AUSTERITY.Definition: a period of living without unnecessary things, and usually without comfort

SACKED.Definition: if you are sacked, you lose your job

BALANCE ITS BOOKS.Definition: to show that the amount of money you spend is not more than what you receive

BAIL OUT.Definition: provide money in support of an organisation that is having financial difficulties

UNDERGO.Definition: start to experience, often something bad

CURRENCIES.Definition: the money used in a particular country

DENOMINATED.Definition: if a debt is denominated in a currency, it is in that currency

CURRENCY.Definition: the money used in a particular country

THEORETICALLY.Definition: in a way that could be true, but is not proven

INTEREST RATES.Definition: the percentage you need to pay to borrow money

INTEREST RATE.Definition: the percentage you need to pay to borrow money

RATE.Definition: short for "interest rate" (the percentage you need to pay to borrow money)

REVENUES.Definition: the money a person, company or country receives

BUDGETS.Definition: the amount of money to be spent

STICK THEIR NECKS OUT.Definition: if you stick your neck out, you put yourself forward for something, even if it might have negative consequences

CAMPAIGN.Definition: to take a series of actions in order to achieve a political result

INTEREST.Definition: the amount of money you pay to borrow money

LEND.Definition: to give money for a short period of time

AMBITIOUS.Definition: an ambitious idea is one that is difficult but brave

INFRASTRUCTURE.Definition: the basic systems and services that a country or organisation needs

SUCCESSORS.Definition: people who come after someone else

TO THE TUNE OF.Definition: (informal) used to emphasise a large number
